div.l: Towarde the Mylle And Bayarde in his hande
The Myller syttenge by the Fuyer he Fonde
For itt was nyghte And Further myghte he noughte
Butte For the loue of god they hym bisoughte
Of herboroughe ⁊and of Ese As For her penye
The Myller sayde agayne yefe þ̉er be enye
Suche As itt is schulle ye haue your parte
Myne howse is strayte butte ye haue lernede Arte
Ye can by Argumente make A place
A myle brode of xxᵗⁱ Fote of space
Lette se now is this place maye suffyse
Or make hitt rowm̉er with speche as is your gyse
Now symon sayde this Iohn by saynte Cutberde
Ay is þou merye And þat is Fayer answerede
I haue herde Men saye schall take of twa thynges
Suche as he Fynde or suche As he brynges
Butte Speciallye I praye the hoste dere
Gette us some Mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make us chere
And we wolle payen truelye atte Fulle
With empty handes Men maye noone haukes tulle
Loo here ower syluer redye For to spende
This Myller to þe towne his doughter sende
For Ale ⁊and brede And rostede hem A Goose
And bonde her horse he schulde no more go loose
And in his owne chambre he made A bedde
With schetis ⁊and with chalons Fayer y spradde
Noughte Frome his owne bedde x · Fote or xij ·
His doughter hadde A bedde All by her Selue
Righte in the Same chambre by and by
Hitt myghte be no bette And Cause why
There was no romer herboroughe in the place
They soupen And they speken hem of solace
And dronken eủer stronge Ale atte beste
